attributes.action: force the Student Loans Company to pass on interest rate cuts
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
From 1 September 2008 to 31 August 2009 the student loans company will charge student interest at 3.8%.

On the average £15,000 loan this amounts to £570 interest each year.

The Bank of England base rate is now 2.0%, and expected to fall further, and given that most expert expect inflation to be zero or negative in the following year.

Why is the prime minister willing to force banks to pass on cuts to its debtors whilst happily earning interest on the students and future of the country?

rejection.details:
There are several petitions already in existence:
http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/StudentIntRate/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
